refnamediv.refpurpose: Acts as entry point to the audio tree.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: AgsChannel is the entry point to the entire audio tree and its nested recycling tree.
Every channel has its own AgsRecallID. As modifying link a new AgsRecyclingContext is indicated, since it acts as a kind of recall id tree context.

refsect2.title: ags_channel_first ()
refsect2.para: Iterates until the first AgsChannel was found.

refsect2.title: ags_channel_last ()
refsect2.para: Iterates until the last AgsChannel was found.

refsect2.title: ags_channel_pad_first ()
refsect2.para: Iterates until the first pad has been reached.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the first AgsChannel with the same audio_channel as channel

refsect2.title: ags_channel_pad_last ()
refsect2.para: Iterates until the last pad has been reached.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the last AgsChannel with the same audio_channel as channel

entry.para: the count of pads to step

refsect2.title: ags_channel_first_with_recycling ()
refsect2.para: Iterates over pads forwards as long as there is no AgsRecycling on the AgsChannel.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the first channel with an AgsRecycling

refsect2.title: ags_channel_last_with_recycling ()
refsect2.para: Iterates over pads backwards as long as there is no AgsRecycling on the AgsChannel.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the last channel with an AgsRecycling

refsect2.title: ags_channel_duplicate_recall ()
refsect2.para: Duplicate AgsRecall templates for use with ags_channel_recursive_play(), but ags_channel_recursive_play_init() may call this function for you.

entry.para: an AgsChannel that contains the AgsRecall templates
the AgsRecallID the newly allocated AgsRecall objects belongs to

refsect2.title: ags_channel_init_recall ()
refsect2.para: Prepare AgsRecall objects to become runnning, ags_channel_recursive_play_init() may call this function for you.

entry.para: an AgsChannel that contains the recalls
the AgsRecallId this recall belongs to

refsect2.title: ags_channel_play ()
refsect2.para: Play one single run of stage step.

refsect2.title: ags_channel_done ()
refsect2.para: Is emitted as playing channel is done.

refsect2.title: ags_channel_cancel ()
refsect2.para: Calls for every matching recall_id ags_recall_cancel()

refsect2.title: ags_channel_remove ()
refsect2.para: Calls for every matching recall_id ags_recall_remove()

refsect2.title: ags_channel_recall_id_set ()
refsect2.programlisting: void ags_channel_recall_id_set (AgsChannel *output, AgsRecallID *recall_id, gboolean ommit_own_channel, guint mode, ...);

refsect2.title: ags_channel_set_link ()
refsect2.para: Change the linking of AgsChannel objects. Sets link, calls ags_channel_set_recycling() and ags_channel_recursive_reset_recall_ids(). Further it does loop detection and makes your machine running. Thus it adds AgsRecallID. Asynchronously only.

entry.para: an other AgsChannel to link with
you may retrieve a AGS_CHANNEL_ERROR_LOOP_IN_LINK error

refsect2.title: ags_channel_set_recycling ()
refsect2.programlisting: void ags_channel_set_recycling (AgsChannel *channel, AgsRecycling *first_recycling, AgsRecycling *last_recycling, gboolean update, gboolean destroy_old);
refsect2.para: Called by ags_channel_set_link() to handle outdated AgsRecycling references. Asynchronously only.

entry.para: the recycling to set for channel->first_recycling
the recycling to set for channel->last_recycling
reset allthough the AgsRecyclings are still the same

refsect2.title: ags_channel_recursive_reset_recycling_context ()
refsect2.para: Resets the recycling container context. Asynchronously only.

refsect2.title: ags_channel_recycling_changed ()
refsect2.programlisting: void ags_channel_recycling_changed (AgsChannel *channel, AgsRecycling *old_start_region, AgsRecycling *old_end_region, AgsRecycling *new_start_region, AgsRecycling *new_end_region, AgsRecycling *old_start_changed_region, AgsRecycling *old_end_changed_region, AgsRecycling *new_start_changed_region, AgsRecycling *new_end_changed_region);

refsect2.title: ags_channel_recursive_play_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: AgsRecallID * ags_channel_recursive_play_init (AgsChannel *channel, gint stage, gboolean arrange_recall_id, gboolean duplicate_templates, gboolean playback, gboolean sequencer, gboolean notation, gboolean resolve_dependencies, AgsRecallID *recall_id);
refsect2.para: Make the tree ready for a new AgsPlayback. Only for asynchronous use, take a look at AgsInitChannel or AgsInitAudio task.

entry.para: valid values for stage are: -1 for running all three stages, or the stages 0 through 2 to run just the specified stage. With stage is meant the AgsRecall run_init_pre, AgsRecall run_init_inter and AgsRecall run_init_post stages.
TRUE if new AgsRecallID objects should be created
TRUE if the AgsRecall templates should be duplicated
TRUE if the purpose is a simple playback of the tree, this option is used to omit the duplication of AgsRecall templates which haven't set AGS_RECALL_PLAYBACK flag
TRUE if the purpose is playing the tree for a sequencer, this option is used to omit the duplication of AgsRecall templates which haven't set the AGS_RECALL_SEQUENCER flag
TRUE if the purpose is playing the tree for a notation, this option is used to omit the duplication of AgsRecall templates which haven't set the AGS_RECALL_NOTATION flag
the initial recall id or NULL

refsect2.title: ags_channel_recursive_play_threaded ()
refsect2.para: Super-threaded version of ags_channel_recursive_play() one single run of stage step. This function expects to be called by AgsIteratorThread and having a functional AgsRecyclingThread setup.

refsect2.title: ags_channel_tillrecycling_cancel ()
refsect2.para: Traverses the tree down and up and calls ags_channel_cancel() for corresponding recall_id .

refsect2.title: ags_channel_recursive_reset_recall_ids ()
refsect2.para: Called by ags_channel_set_link() to handle running AgsAudio objects correctly. This function destroys AgsRecall objects which were uneeded because they became invalid due to unlinking. By the way it destroys the uneeded AgsRecallID objects, too. Additionally it creates AgsRecall and AgsRecallID objects to prepare becoming a running object (AgsAudio or AgsChannel). By the clean up the invalid AgsRecall objects will be removed. Once the clean up has done ags_channel_recursive_play_init() will be called for every playing instance that was found.

entry.para: an AgsChannel that was linked with link
an AgsChannel that was linked with channel

refsect2.title: ags_channel_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a AgsChannel, linking tree to audio .

refsect2.title: The soundcard property
refsect2.para: The assigned AgsSoundcard acting as default sink.

refsect2.title: The done signal
refsect2.para: The ::done signal is invoked during termination of playback.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The recycling-changed signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (AgsChannel *old_start_region, GObject *old_end_region, GObject *new_start_region, GObject *new_end_region, GObject *old_start_changed_region, GObject *old_end_changed_region, GObject *new_start_changed_region, GObject *new_end_changed_region, GObject *arg8, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: The ::recycling-changed signal is invoked to notify modified recycling tree.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
